name: operation, computer, laptop, active mode | operation, computer, laptop, active mode | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9684/documentation

The laptop use in the active mode includes the share of the laptop computer production, the energy consumption (use-phase) for the laptop (incl. monitor) and the rail and road transport from factory to user. Energy consumption of laptop computers (use-phase) vary a lot depending on the device looked at. Min.-Max. values are listed; the mean value is calculated via the most likely value according to the reference data. Due to relatively vague literature data for laptop computer life span, assumptions had to be made.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Describes the use of a laptop computer in the active mode. Calculated per 1 hour of laptop use. Laptop computer life span assumed to be 4 years. Active mode 6.5 hours a day (office use), 240 days a year. UCTE production mix applied for electricity consumption (low voltage).
category: J:Information and communication/62:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities/620:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data is based on information by international computer manufacturers and literature (active mode consumption).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: No technology involved, except for the production of the laptop computer, which is described in another dataset.
